title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent in Redondo Beach, CA

content.rendered:
Planning a move to Redondo Beach, California? Did you know, the city has more artists, designers, and people working in media than 90% of the communities in America? We know finding rental apartments in LA is a tough row to hoe. So, before making the big move, take a look through our neighborhood guide, containing all the key info you’ll need. Keep it handy for details on average rent and restaurants in Redondo Beach. Certainly, this neighborhood guide will make your search for rooms for rent in Redondo Beach, CA, much easier.

Getting to know Redondo Beach

Redondo Beach is a coastal city in Los Angeles County, California. It’s part of the Greater Los Angeles area’s South Bay region.

Redondo Beach is a fantastic area in which to build a life. An intriguing aspect of the city is that, despite its small size, it has a very high number of young, bachelor, and upwardly mobile residents. Among its many benefits is its central position, which gives residents easy access to all key locations; you can get to all parts of Los Angeles, including LAX and Orange County, from here.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Los Angeles

Finding rooms for rent in Redondo Beach, CA

Finding rooms for rent in Redondo Beach

The average rent in Redondo Beach is not only among the most expensive in California, but it’s also consistently ranked as being among the most expensive in the entire United States. Although renting apartments in LA is hard, residents here are kind and welcoming. Whether they live in a luxurious house or a more modest condo, they give the city a small-town feel with all the benefits of living in a global environment.

Whether you’re moving for a job, moving closer to your family, or simply upgrading your home, this city won’t disappoint you! Let’s look into the best neighborhoods with a variety of rooms for rent in Redondo Beach, CA.

Related: Roomi’s Guide For The First Time Renter

Top neighborhoods in Redondo Beach

  • North of Torrance Boulevard: This area of South Redondo is considered the more central section of the city, containing a mix of townhouse complexes and single-family houses. There are two beautiful areas of listed historic properties that might provide homeowners with considerable tax benefits.
  • El Nino: This charming neighborhood is largely made up of older houses with spacious backyards. These properties are set back from the main street, allowing for beautiful front yard spaces.
  • Villas South: More townhouses are permitted in this region, which is designated for multi-family housing. Many first-time tenants in may find affordable rooms for rent in Redondo Beach right here. Moreover, residents have easy access to the main commuting routes.

Average rent in Redondo Beach

Related: Apartment Security Systems: Steps You Can Take As A Renter

University life in Redondo Beach

Here, you’ll experience everything in terms of culture and social life! While searching rooms for rent in Redondo Beach, students will discover many others who are in the same boat as they are, creating possibilities for friendships and socializing. Moreover, it will help with opportunities for room sharing and saving money!

Top universities to check out in and around the city:

  • El Camino College
  • University of Southern California
  • LB Long Beach City College
  • California State University, Dominguez Hills
  • Marymount California University

Related: 7 Ways to Save Money and Make Money in College

How transit friendly is Redondo Beach?

1. Walkability

Sightseeing and hunting for rooms for rent in Redondo Beach is easily done on foot. The city has a walk score of 74, so you can explore the entire city in only a few hours, popping into a café or two along the way.

2. Public Transportation

The Transit Division of the City of Redondo Beach Community Services Department operates Beach Cities Transit (BCT) and the WAVE Dial-A-Ride services. Use Google Maps and view the Transit Instructions document for ease of traveling.

3. Car Rentals

Car rentals are useful when you’re traveling long distances to look at renting apartments in LA. Here are the top car rental companies you might want to look into when searching for rooms for rent in Redondo Beach, CA.

4. Bikeability

The bike route in Redondo Beach goes from Herondo Street to the pier and then on to Torrance Beach. On weekends and holidays, this roadway can get packed as vehicles, walkers, and other cyclists enjoy the fresh winds and sunshine along the shore.

Cultural activities in Redondo Beach

A trip to the local museum is the best way to get to know any new city. Visitors to Redondo Beach may learn about the city’s history, culture, and people at the Redondo Beach Historical Museum. A gift shop, rose garden, and the historic Morrell House, constructed in 1906, are all on the premises.

While the region is mostly a beach town, you’ll be amazed to find that only minutes from the coast is a magnificent nature area with meadows, woods, streams, and ponds. Hopkins Wilderness Park is an 11-acre oasis of natural beauty in the heart of the metropolis. It was first designated as a conservation area decades ago. Now, it’s becoming a popular get away from crowded beach areas.

Related: The Eco-Life: 5 Energy-Saving Tips for Renters

Shopping in Redondo Beach

Redondo Beach, known for its beautiful beaches and horseshoe-shaped pier, has truly got something for everyone. In addition to the stunning beaches, you’ll also find charming shops and exquisite eateries here.

Plus, the nightclubs and bars in Redondo Beach are some of the most sophisticated that California has to offer. So, don’t forget to hit one of these spots after shopping for a fun night out!

This world-class seaside city has become a hotspot for its one-of-a-kind combination of big-name brands, gift shops, and more that you won’t find anywhere else. Some of the places you can’t afford to miss are listed below:

  • South Bay Galleria
  • Riviera Village
  • The Redondo Beach Pier

Do you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Redondo Beach? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!
